tool_description:
Get favicon-related information about a particular website.

The most obvious service is getting the icons of a website. In addition to the classic favicon, the API can also get the icons for iOS, Android Chrome, Windows and Safari pinned tabs. This can be handy to get the high resolution logo of a website.

The API also allows you to get an icon preview. For example, what if you add a website to the home screen of an Android device using Chrome? How would it look like? The API generates such image.
name: RealFaviconGenerator
title: RealFaviconGenerator

api_list.name: Website icon
api_list.description: Get the favicon or favicon-related icon of a website: its classic favicon, its touch icon, its icon for Android, etc.

required_parameters.name: site
required_parameters.description: The URL of the website to analyze

optional_parameters.name: platform
optional_parameters.description: The targeted platform. For example, you may want to get the icon used by iOS Safari (ie. the Apple Touch icon). In this case, use ios. Possible values are ios, android_chrome, windows, safari_pinned_tab and desktop (the default value)

api_list.name: Website preview
api_list.description: Generate a preview of the website for a given platform. For example, by passing ios as the platform, the API sends an image representing how the site would look like if it was added to the home screen of an iOS device.

optional_parameters.name: platform
optional_parameters.description: The targeted platform. Possible values are desktop, ios, android_chrome, windows and safari_pinned_tab

api_list.name: Website analysis
api_list.description: Analyze the favicon and related icons of a website.

required_parameters.name: site
required_parameters.description: The URL of the website to analyze
